skill.name: invoice-organizer
skill.description: Automatically organizes invoices and receipts for tax preparation by reading messy files, extracting key information, renaming them consistently, and sorting them into logical folders. Turns hours of manual bookkeeping into minutes of automated organization.
skill.summary: Automates invoice and receipt organization for tax preparation by extracting data, renaming files to standard format, and sorting into organized folder structures.
skill.author: ComposioHQ

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill contains benign shell command examples in documentation for file operations. No command injection, network calls, or cryptographic vulnerabilities exist. File system access is limited to user-specified directories with explicit user approval.

content.value_statement: Manual invoice organization takes hours of tedious work. This skill automates the process by reading invoices, extracting key data, renaming files to standard format, and sorting them into logical folders for tax season.
actual_capabilities: Extracts data from PDF invoices and image receipts including vendor, date, amount, and invoice number
Renames files to standardized format: YYYY-MM-DD Vendor - Invoice - Description.ext
Organizes invoices into folders by vendor, category, time period, or tax deductible status
Generates CSV summary reports for accountants and accounting software import
Handles multiple file formats: PDF, JPG, PNG, email attachments, and bank statements
Preserves original files while creating organized copies for safety
limitations: OCR accuracy depends on image quality and scan readability
Cannot process encrypted or password-protected PDF files
Categorization may require manual review for ambiguous expense types
Does not connect to external APIs or accounting software platforms

use_cases.title: Tax Season Organization
use_cases.description: Prepare financial records for tax filing by organizing scattered invoices and receipts into a clean, categorized structure ready for accountants.
use_cases.target_user: Individual taxpayers and small business owners

use_cases.title: Monthly Expense Reconciliation
use_cases.description: Sort and categorize business expenses by category (software, office, travel) to track spending and prepare reimbursement claims.

use_cases.title: Multi-Year Document Archive
use_cases.description: Organize years of accumulated invoices into a searchable, browsable folder structure for audit preparation and long-term record keeping.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Invoice Organization
prompt_templates.prompt: Organize these invoices for taxes. Read all files in this folder, extract the date, vendor, and amount from each one, rename them to YYYY-MM-DD format, and organize them by vendor folder.
prompt_templates.scenario: User has a messy folder of invoices and wants them organized quickly

prompt_templates.title: Category-Based Sorting
prompt_templates.prompt: Read all receipts and invoices in this directory. Extract vendor, date, amount, and description. Then organize them into folders by expense category: Software, Office Supplies, Travel, Services. Create a CSV spreadsheet with all the extracted details.
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants invoices sorted by business expense category

prompt_templates.title: Tax-Deductible Organization
prompt_templates.prompt: Organize these financial documents for tax preparation. Extract all invoice information and sort into Deductible, Partially-Deductible, and Personal folders. Generate a summary report with totals by category for my accountant.
prompt_templates.scenario: User needs tax-deductible expenses organized for filing

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Year Archive
prompt_templates.prompt: I have invoices from 2022, 2023, and 2024 mixed together. Read all files, determine the year from each invoice, and organize them into year folders. Within each year, create vendor subfolders. Export a summary CSV with year, vendor, amount totals.
prompt_templates.scenario: User has years of disorganized invoices spanning multiple years

best_practices: Always review extracted data for accuracy before finalizing organization, especially for tax-deductible expenses
Keep original files as backup before reorganizing, or use copy mode instead of move operations
Establish a consistent naming convention and folder structure before processing large batches of invoices
anti_patterns: Processing financial documents without first reviewing what data will be extracted and where files will be moved
Relying solely on OCR for critical tax documents without manual verification of extracted amounts
Moving files directly without keeping backups, risking data loss if errors occur

faq.question: What file types can this skill process?
faq.answer: The skill handles PDF invoices, image receipts (JPG, PNG), email attachments, screenshots, and bank statements. Text-based documents can also be processed.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my original files?
faq.answer: By default, the skill creates organized copies of your files in a new folder structure. Original files remain untouched in their original location unless you specifically request to move them.

faq.question: How accurate is the data extraction?
faq.answer: Extraction accuracy depends on document quality. Clean, readable PDFs and scans produce near-perfect results. Poor quality images may have errors. The skill always flags files needing manual review.

faq.question: Can I customize the folder organization?
faq.answer: Yes, you can choose from preset patterns (by vendor, category, year, quarter, tax category) or describe a custom folder structure that fits your needs.

faq.question: What happens if an invoice cannot be read?
faq.answer: Files that cannot be processed are moved to a Needs-Review folder with the original filename preserved. The summary report will list all files requiring attention.

faq.question: Does this skill work offline?
faq.answer: Yes, all processing happens locally on your machine. No data is sent to external services, making it safe for confidential financial documents.
